doc:
Uncle Cyp and Aunt Sap Brasfield https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uncle_Cyp_and_Aunt_Sap_Brasfield 0 Laurence Lemarr Brasfield (March 1, 1898–September 9, 1966) and Neva Inez Fisher Brasfield (March 14, 1889–March 19, 1980), better known as Uncle Cyp and Aunt Sap, were an American country comedy duo with acting careers beginning in the late 1910s that spanned vaudeville to network television. Laurence played on Broadway, and the married couple had leading roles in hundreds of dramatic and comedic performances on Southern and Midwestern tent repertory show circuits before joining ABC-TV's Ozark Jubilee from 1955–1960. Laurence_Lemarr_Brasfield ( March_1_,_1898 – September_9_,_1966 ) and Neva_Inez_Fisher_Brasfield ( March_14_,_1889 – March_19_,_1980 ) , better_known as Uncle_Cyp and Aunt_Sap , were an_American_country_comedy_duo with acting_careers beginning in the_late_1910s that spanned vaudeville to network_television . Laurence played on Broadway , and the_married_couple had_leading roles in hundreds of dramatic_and_comedic_performances on Southern_and_Midwestern_tent_repertory show circuits before joining ABC-TV 's_Ozark_Jubilee from 1955 – 1960 .
